1a.Q: Often fails to give close attention to details or makes careless mistakes in schoolwork, work, or other activities.

2a.Q: Often has difficulty sustaining attention in tasks or play activities.

3a.Q: Often does not seem to listen when spoken to directly.

4a.Q: Often does not follow through on instructions and fails to finish schoolwork, chores, or duties in the workplace (not due to failure to understand directions).

5a.Q: Often has difficulty organizing tasks and activities.

6a.Q: Often avoids, dislikes, or is reluctant to engage in tasks that require sustained mental effort (such as schoolwork or homework).

7a.Q: Often loses things necessary for tasks or activities (e.g., toys, school assignments, pencils, books, tools).

8a.Q: Is often easily distracted by extraneous stimuli.

9a.Q: Is often forgetful in daily activities.

10a.Q: Often fidgets with hands or feet or squirms in seat.

11a.Q: Often leaves seat in classroom or in other situations in which remaining seated is expected.

12a.Q: Often runs about or climbs excessively in situations in which it is inappropriate (in adolescents or adults, may be limited to subjective feelings or restlessness).

13a.Q: Often has difficulty playing or engaging in leisure activities quietly.

14a.Q: Is often “on the go” or often acts as if “driven by a motor.”

16a.Q: Often blurts out answers before questions have been completed.

18a.Q: Often interrupts or intrudes on others (i.e., interrupts conversations or games).
